meanings.definition: Gathered together in a large quantity.
meanings.sent1: The amassed toys filled the entire room.
meanings.sent2: The amassed crowd cheered loudly at the concert.
meanings.sent3: The amassed snacks at the party disappeared quickly.
meanings.sent4: Her amassed knowledge on the subject impressed everyone.
meanings.sent5: The amassed clouds darkened the sky before the storm.

meanings.sent1: The amassed wealth of the family was evident in their luxurious lifestyle.
meanings.sent2: The amassed experience of the detective helped solve the case quickly.
meanings.sent3: The amassed stories from his travels made him a captivating storyteller.
meanings.sent4: Her amassed collection of vintage coins was a treasure trove.
meanings.sent5: The amassed dust on the old bookshelf showed years of neglect.
